contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox District DE | name=Burgenlandkreis | state=Saxony-Anhalt | former regierungsbezirk=[[Halle (region)|Halle]] | dissolved = 2007-07-01 | capital=[[Naumburg]] | area=1,040.91 | population=143,340 | population_as_of=2000 | density=138 | carsign=BLK | url= [http://www.burgenlandkreis.de burgenlandkreis.de] | map=saxony_anhalt_blk.png }} The '''Burgenlandkreis''' was a district (''Kreis'') in the south of [[Saxony-Anhalt]], [[Germany]]. Neighboring districts are (from north clockwise) [[Merseburg-Querfurt]], [[Weißenfels (district)|Weißenfels]], [[Leipziger Land]], [[Aschersleben-Staßfurt]], [[Altenburger Land]], [[Greiz (district)|Greiz]], district-free [[Gera]], [[Saale-Holzland]], [[Weimarer Land]], [[Sömmerda (district)|Sömmerda]] and the [[Kyffhäuserkreis]]. == History == The district was created in 1994 when the districts Naumburg, Nebra and Zeitz were merged. == Geography == Main rivers in the district are the [[Saale]] and its affluent [[Unstrut]], and also in the south of the district the ''Weiße Elster''. The highest elevation is the Seeligenbornberg (355 m), the lowest elevation is in the Saale valley near Gosek (97.8m). <!--==Partnerships==--> == Coat of arms == {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Burgenlandkreis (1994-2007).png|100px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms show a city wall in the bottom part, symbolizing the many castles in the district which also gave it its name. The six grapes symbolize the [[wine|viticulture]] in the area around Freyburg, one of the northernmost wine areas of Europe. The sword and key in the top part are the symbols of [[Saint Peter|St. Peter]] and [[Paul of Tarsus|Saint Paul]], the patrons of the cathedrals in Naumburg and Zeitz. These two symbols were taken from the coat of arms of the Zeitz district when it was incorporated into the Burgenlandkreis. |} ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! width=25% align=left|Towns ! width=50% align=left|[[Amt (political division)|Verwaltungsgemeinschaften]] ! width=25% align=left|Free municipalities |- valign=top || #[[Naumburg]] || #[[An der Finne]] (incl. towns [[Bad Bibra]] and [[Eckartsberga]]) #[[Bad Kösen]] (incl. town Bad Kösen) #[[Droyßiger-Zeitzer Forst]] #[[Unstruttal (Verwaltungsgemeinschaft)|Unstruttal]] (incl. towns [[Freyburg, Germany|Freyburg]], [[Laucha an der Unstrut|Laucha]] and [[Nebra]]) #[[Wethautal]] (incl. towns [[Osterfeld]] and [[Stößen]]) #[[Zeitz|Zeitzer Land]] (incl. town [[Zeitz]]) || #[[Elsteraue]] |} == External links == *[http://www.burgenlandkreis.de Official website] (German) {{Germany districts saxony-anhalt}} {{coord|51.17|11.75|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Burgenlandkreis]] [[de:Burgenlandkreis (1994–2007)]] [[id:Burgenlandkreis]] [[mk:Бургенландкрајс (поранешен округ)]] [[nl:Burgenlandkreis (1994-2007)]] [[pt:Burgenlandkreis]] [[ro:Burgenland (district)]]
